website_summaries.verdict: A solid, good-quality water filter pitcher that's ideal for those who need a smaller size.
pros: Praised for its sleek design, this pitcher stands out for holding up to daily use and being perfect when a small pitcher is needed
Is great for smaller refrigerators or households or use in RVs
cons: A few also experienced cracks or leaks after months of use

customer_reviews.title: Only removes certain metals
customer_reviews.text: I measured the TDS (total dissolved solids) after filtering. It remains the same as the unfiltered tap water (~150 ppm). I called the Britta Tech Support and was informed that the product only removes chlorine and certain metals such as copper. Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.author: lao qiao

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Space Saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Brita that cracked after three years. I like that it doesn’t take up much room in the refrigerator like most standard sized models. This unit is good for one or two people, but if you have a family I would recommend upsizing. Also, this is a real deal Brita. It arrived in a Brita shipping box and was packaged accordingly. See photos.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Right size pitcher but refilling design can be improved
customer_reviews.text: Long time Brita user and switched to 5 cup pitcher to check out whether it fits our usage. Looks like it does! It is not super heavy like the 10 cup one and this is just the right size. Only exception is when we have guests. You can't serve many people from this, you will need to refill and wait for the filtering to complete. Also, I wish it had an opening flap kind of opening instead of removing the lid every single time to refill.
customer_reviews.author: i.Re-view!

customer_reviews.title: and best of all it is short enough to fit under ...
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher is perfectly sized for my needs, and best of all it is short enough to fit under the sink tap, as well as in my slightly smaller than average refrigerator. I have a dual-basin sink, and my previous pitcher was too tall to fit under the faucet (on the "ledge" between the two basins). I didn't have any trouble with the lid once I made sure that the filter was seated correctly. I would have preferred the red color, but I wasn't about to spend $3 more just for differently colored plastic. I also liked the fact it came with one of the advanced/expert/ultimate/platinum/omega/whatever-it's-called higher-quality filters.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER 5 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Started using this beginning of April. I liked it. 4 days ago, early September, the indicator light quit working when I installed a new Brita filter. Without the indicator light, I have no way of knowing if the filter is working effectively or when to replace it. This thing should not have broken like a piece of garbage after only 5 months. Extremely annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: skylight

customer_reviews.title: Not so clean!
customer_reviews.text: I used this Brita water Pitcher for about a month now. I didnt realize it at first but after a while some kind of black particles started to deposit at the bottom of my water cup. It happens to me multiple times although I followed the instruction and disposed of the water as instructed. Yes I do washed my cup regularly (at first, I thought the black sand was from my cup), so it is definitely from the Pitcher itself. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kien Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!! It occurs black dust!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got shocked when I saw this black dust in the bottom of my mug cup. I am a current pregnant women and wanted to drink safe water with Brita filter. BUT I am worried about my baby now:( It can be super hazardous to baby to drink this chemical water. I want to know what it is and get full refund for damages. If my baby got defected by this Brita, I will be going to further action. (Plus, I followed direction that "the water from the first two fills be discarded or used to water flowers and plants etc")
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek design, the perfect size for our small fridge. Most importantly, it transformed our cloudly NYC water to not just drinkable but actually really great tasting water. Only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the lid is annoying to snap back on and off, to the point where refilling it sometimes feels like an effort. But I'd still buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It was nearly impossible to pry the reservoir off the pitcher. Used all my strength and it wouldn't budge. Ended up having to use a blade to pop it off. By the time it came off, the pitcher was full of scratches and red paint marks that can't be scraped off. Returning this product as it is very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Reservoir is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I am going to keep this pitcher or not. I have had several Brita pitchers over the years, and never a problem like this. I can't get the reservoir out of the pitcher - I see a suggestion to use a knife?? Pull with both hands? I have arthritis and I'm waiting to have a visitor that will try to get it out, but it's pretty useless if I can't take the reservoir out myself, to wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Small size means asy to lift and pour when full
customer_reviews.text: Handy size that is much easier to manage than the larger pitchers. When my doctor told me that soft plastic water bottles cause cancer, I stopped buying them at rhe supermarket. Put a water purifier on my kitchen faucet, but the water in my overpriced apartment still had a horrible metallic taste. Bought this pitcher as a secondary filter and fill it from the purifier. The water tastes wonderful, just like it did when I was a child before all the pollution, additives and pvc pipes. Highly recommend this pitcher as a great filter to give you decent water.
customer_reviews.author: mcerner

customer_reviews.title: It broke for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Mom one for Mother's Day. Month and 2 months and a bit later they get up one morning to find it has cracked. really annoyed. Replacing with a Target brand. My Target brand one has made it two years without cracking and this one can't even make it two months.
customer_reviews.author: Hil M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product don't get!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product. It's very cheap. I couldn't even fit the filter into the red insert section because the size wasn't right. Also the plastic is really cheap and I was afraid that it would break when I pushed in the filter. Made sure to align the filter in with the horizontal stripes on the bottom but wouldn't go in at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Dope addition to the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: College student here who felt like I was wasting too many plastic bottles so I decided to try filtered water for the first time. I have a very small fridge, but this fits perfectly. The 5 - cup is definitely enough for two people who are moderate water drinkers. Second day of using it and my water tastes really clean, the lid flashes green when you pour a glass, and when it turns red the filter needs to be replaced right away. I'll be stocking up on filters soon!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Indicator useless- flawed design.
customer_reviews.text: % Indicator is useless - BIG ISSUE! Always says 100%. Needs refilling often..good for 1 person drinking 4 cups a day- any more than that-refilling too often. Fits easily in refrigerator
customer_reviews.author: vaneau

customer_reviews.title: Compact and good for 1-2 people.
customer_reviews.text: The Brita filter fit nice and tightly, creating a good seal. The flow rate of the filter is pretty good. The pitcher is slim, but seems pretty durable. The lid has a "change filter" reminder LED, which was a neat surprise. I think it detects how many times you've opened the top to refill with water to determine when to change the filter. It can hold about 1 liter or more, which is fine for me and my wife. I'd rather not have water that's been sitting for a very long time. I'll update this review if there's any dissatisfaction later on.
customer_reviews.author: ThrowinStacks

customer_reviews.title: Brita Filter Poor Fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pitcher for my bathroom. The pitcher small size was what caught my eye. The problem is that the filter does not properly fit the pitcher. There is gaping space around the filter once it is inserted so the resulting water is not totally filtered. I have a larger Briter pitcher in which I use the same filters and the fit is perfect. So the problem is the pitcher and not the filter. I have not elected to return the pitcher because it's jut not worth the bother but I would advise potential purchasers of this pitcher to shop for other pitchers.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda5555

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I like this small Brita. It fits in the door of my fridge. It’s easy to use so long as you read and follow the instructions. I have not noticed any black flakes. I like the taste and can not tell the difference between gallon of waters I buy and this when it is cold. Though I do think it tastes a little “dirty” when at room temp. All and all I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, looks good, and the water tastes great!
customer_reviews.text: Filters fast and tastes great! I didn't think our tap water tasted bad, but this definitely tastes better. I researched carefully: This model has a firmly fitted lid with an indicator light to warn when it's time to buy another filter. I use the filtered water to make my ice cubes, too. I have a very small refrigerator and my hands have tendonitis and arthritis, so the smaller size is better for me. I do need to refill often. I don't know why I waited so long to buy a water filter.
customer_reviews.author: StoddardsHale

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I dion't know if this size filter is too big for this size pitcher, but I have used a bigger Brita and the water was good. This water from this small pitcher has an awful taste and when I dumped out all the water, a blackish color water ran out if the filter. Bad filter? Bad size? Don't know but I am not pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Judie

customer_reviews.title: ALGAE again!
customer_reviews.text: Had to throw away my first brita pitcher because I couldn't get rid of the algae. The second one now has algae too. I use the pitch every day so the water doesn't sit. I've probably been drinking algae water before the green became obvious. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: All around great, the sticker on the bottom is annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Great pitcher, and does a great job of removing some of the contaminants out of the water where I live. However, there is a sticker on the bottom that is put on with a ton of bubbles. So, when I would wash it, soap would get trapped under it. Wasn't a huge fan so I removed it. It left a ton of adhesive behind. I would recommend picking up some goo gone when you pick up the pitcher
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: It’s Broken Already...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the product for its slim size and style. The pitcher developed a crack along its side and is leaking and waiting to be tossed. Have had many Brita products and never had one break like this. Thinking about trying third party product since there is no warranty I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Chesnic

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher is an absolute waste of space. The lid does not cover the entire container so you have an opening straight to your freshly cleaned water so it can absorb all the smells in your fridge. The upper reservoir for tap water is so small you can only filter a cup or two at a time even though the container supposedly holds 5 cups. Not enough water to fill up a saucepan if you need it. You'll have to wait several minutes to refill it one or two more times to boil pasta. Probably the most disappointing design I've seen from Brita. We ended up buying a larger one a few weeks later
customer_reviews.author: Aliki and Lykos

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my liking.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a single household, but I drink water constantly. This pitcher was too small for my liking and I returned it immediately upon pulling it out of the box and seeing how small it was up close. It would take repeated fills to satisfy my thirst throughout the day, not to mention any guests. In addition cleaning will be a chore (as some other people have mentioned), because of the way it’s constructed. I love the different color choices, but this is perhaps made for a “tiny home” or a dormitory-sized only. I wouldn’t peg this for everyday, “averaged”-sized household use.
customer_reviews.author: MzKiesha

customer_reviews.title: I’m completely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this for my dog so she could drink filtered water instead of tap. Anywho, I’ve never been a huge water drinker but the water is so good that the Brita is now mine AND the dog’s. This brita produces such crisp and clean tasting water. And it’s the perfect size for the fridge. Doesn’t take up lots of space. Can fit on the shelf or the door.
customer_reviews.author: TRob

customer_reviews.title: Black residue
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, its charcoal residue which is considered safe to drink but itss unsightly so i tried many ways to filter it off completely but to no avail. Soaked it in water, filtered it through at least about 50 times, shook it etc. didnt work. Super disappointing because i wanted to stop buying bottled water but seems like i have to go back to it until i find a better water filter.
customer_reviews.author: Hee Young Kim

customer_reviews.title: Useful size for small space, tasty water, poor design
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Brita pitchers for years. I bought this because I needed a smaller size for a small fridge. The size is perfect, the water tastes good but the design is poor. The plastic insert is RIDICULOUSLY difficult to get out. I tried multiple times to get it out and gave up. Finally today, after many months of owning, realizing it really needed to be washed properly I used the hook of a hanger to pull it out. Way too much effort-would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: RHSPT

customer_reviews.title: I use it to filter tap water
customer_reviews.text: After filtering tap water with this, it really tastes better. The filter gets rid of all the minute particles from tap water. The filter life span blue light isn't really useful because you can check if the filter is in good condition by just checking how smooth the water flows.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Unlike Brita pitchers in the past, this one can be disassembled for cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: The top should be transparent and easier to take off and on. As the electronic timer is entirely unnecessary, I leave the top off. If it were transparent, I would leave it on to be able to see if all the water has gone down from the top container into the pitcher. As for timing when to change filers, just mark your calendar. Otherwise the pitcher is excellent. The slim shape makes it easy to fit into a crowded refrigerator. The water tastes great. If you use genuine Brita filters, you will not the problems mentioned by some viewers.s
customer_reviews.author: Observer

customer_reviews.title: Good pitcher for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: This is a smaller pitcher. Don't expect to water everyone's mouths at a small gathering or a party. I read some reviews and people complained about it. This isn't a giant pitcher. You're not gonna find a better pitcher that will not break your arm off holding it, and also fit in your fridge. That being said, I would recommend you only use the filter they gave you for amount a month. You can tell when it's going bad when the taste changes. I would recommend you order the long last Brita filters, as they are the ones that filter lead and many other things in tap water. The standard filter barely filters anything. Fyi
customer_reviews.author: Andizzle Chauizzle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I like this pitcher, and the small size is very handy in space saving. I have used Brita filters for years, and have had good success. I think the instructions say that you don't need to fill your pitcher and discard water before using. However, some people say they have seen some black powder at the bottom. A suggestion - I have always found good results by filling and discarding 3 times before use, and I have not seen any black in my pitcher or cups. I like the taste of the water better with Brita, and the filtering of some nasty chemicals. I would buy the pitcher/Brita filters again.
customer_reviews.author: rescuemom843

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second small Brita unit I've owned. The lid on this one is so much better than the one I bought in 2009. It allows me to pour water while it's still dripping down through the filter because the lid tightly closes off the water fill chamber and just lets me pour from the bottom, filtered water, reservoir. Also, the counter is a great improvement over the old manual date reminder. I am hoping the battery does not wear out on it, or that it's at least replaceable. I live tiny and by myself and so the 5-cup size is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Harley

customer_reviews.title: PPM doesn't change much after filtration.
customer_reviews.text: Simple put this only removed about 10% - 20% or the particles in my tap water. I tested it with a ppm meter I got here on Amazon. I verified the meter using distilled water (0 ppm). Its effectiveness varied often. It takes quite some time for the water to trickle down the filter. Perhaps my filter is defective but I doubt it. I think the product is designed to make people "feel good" about their water, but little else.
customer_reviews.author: T Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest plastic ever--designed to crack
customer_reviews.text: I am convinced BRITA uses the cheapest plastic imaginable to make customers have to replace their pitchers. I accidentally cracked my old pitcher by missing the counter and hitting the edge of the pitcher on it. Bought a new one from amazon and it arrived cracked inside the package. ANY little bump will break this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Stock Dizzle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but does not replace water coolers
customer_reviews.text: Does the job it is supposed to do but I think nothing will take the strong chlorine taste in our water. It is called Ft. Lauderdale water for a reason. I have a Culligan water filter setup and the use of this pitcher is ok for my dogs to fill their water bowls but luckily I don’t drink much water. Those who do usually buy the big water containers that are picked up and replaced. The dogs don’t have stool weakness after drinking the filtered water so that saves me a great deal of money instead of buying the large blue water cooler solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great for apartments. Water without the weird taste
customer_reviews.text: This is great for those that live in apartments where the only source of water is from the tap. Water from the kitchen faucet, while good enough for some, never was good enough for me, given the distinct taste that accompanies it. This works great at removing various impurities, giving the water a very clean taste. The filters last long enough that you won't be spending all that much to maintain having clean water. This, of course will depend on how many people will be using it. We have about three total people here, and the filter lasts about a couple months, give or take.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. Needs measuring marks
customer_reviews.text: We've been using ours for over a year. Convenient size. Easy to handle. Easy to clean (pop the handle end of the reservoir out with a fork tine). Filters last a long time when only two people are using it. My main complaint is that there are no markings on the pitcher or the reservoir to tell you how much water to put in. Two refills of (up to the first ledge) will usually leave a quarter inch of water in the reservoir. I'd like something on the pitcher that says "you have 12oz of space left" and something on the reservoir that says "fill to this line for 12oz". Otherwise, I use it daily and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work great for me
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my college dorm, and it is difficult to fully close after you fill it up. It is a good size. However, my main complaint is that it does not fully filter all I needed it to. My water is very iron-y, and I was hoping that the visible particles would get filtered out. This is not the case, and I have avoided using it since I saw a layer of red towards the bottom of the container. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shilscher

customer_reviews.title: Maggots.......
customer_reviews.text: So we bought this product a few weeks ago and have been using it regularly, and I don't know if it's because we leave it out on the counter or what, but I went to pour it and boil the water for tea, and there were little white maggots floating around in there. I looked at the bottom of the filter, and there are little white dots which I didn't see when I put the filter in the pitcher. Like I said, I'm not sure if it's because we left it out, but I have used other Brita products and this is the first time I am having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Che

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Waste
customer_reviews.text: The pitcher is fine, I like it's size etc but I could have bought a plain pitcher for a lot less. The first morning (after doing things to set up as instructed) I had coffee with this filtered water and it was terrible tasting. So I ran ANOTHER 3 plain waters through it, thinking I must not have gotten whatever was supposed to be cleared by doing this. Then I made my True Lemon Leomonade with it, and it also tasted terrible. I'm sorry! Maybe it's a matter of taste. Yet this is my simple truth so I'm telling it.
customer_reviews.author: dnta

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't do anything
customer_reviews.text: I have used a filter system for years and rarely bought water bottles. It only costs $200 at Home Depot. But I moved temporarily to an area with poor water systems and decided to get one of these pitchers. I was severely disappointed because it really doesn't do anything to the flavor or quality of the water. You get what you pay for I guess. I ended up getting another filter system at Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lua

customer_reviews.title: Great filter pitcher!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was crazy but this filter really does get the job done. I got it due to the coronavirus and not wanting to use all the water bottles that I bought just in case. Plus, you know.. less plastic? Anyways, so it really does clean the water from the faucet. It doesn’t taste funny anymore. It just tastes clean. It’s so easy to assemble and the filter it comes with can last you two months! It also has this little green light that lets you know something that I forgot, lol. Overall I love it! I should have purchased this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes GOOD, not just "not bad"
customer_reviews.text: After living in the country with a good well for over a decade situations occurred that forced a move into town. The water in this town has a pretty ghastly chlorine taste to it. My daughter would only drink bottled water and even that didn't taste like home to her. Enter the Brita. It's amazing how good the water tastes after filtering. I expected it to not taste bad, but it's beyond expectations. I'm saving money and space not having bottled water all over and reducing plastic going into the world as well. It's better for the planet and my family. Smartest purchase I've made in years.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: I went with white vs the other colors since it was cheaper. Functionality is the same.
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this pitcher to use at work. Smaller than I imagine but will work for me in my cubicle office. I hope to drink 3 of the pitcher a day to get in my water intake. It’s cute. I have a small fridge at work but I don’t think it’ll fit. I would fit one of those medium size fridge though. The installation of the filter was easy, no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big enough, Not heavy and pours right into my Kerug tank without dribbling everywhere : )
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger pitcher and thought do I want to get a smaller one, but it was a flash price deal and I needed a filter, picher was old so I’m like, get this thing and it’s just “spectacular” yes I did use the “spectacular!” word. I think it’s beautiful I can’t say enough and I’ve had pictures for like 20 years. Not too small and not as heavy as a big one, easy to pour from it directly into my kerug, even held sideways to clear the upper cabinet. I might get a second one, one for the fridge, Cold water for me, one for room temp kitty water.
customer_reviews.author: John Swenbeck

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: The fountain water is not trustworthy but I am comfortable knowing that my Brita filter is working to remove any harm before I drink it. I can taste a difference and that gives me some peace of mind. Love the Turquoise color - not too green or blue, not bright - just a nice color. (Hey, some people are picky about colors.) The handle is comfortable when lifting the full pitcher. Refilling is a breeze as the lid comes off / on easily; replacing the filter is quick & painless too. I have recommended this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jaahnavi

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 5-cup pitcher to replace a larger 'lake' version that I had purchased and returned (couldn't even get the lid on that one). The small pitcher holds exactly the right amount to fill my 5-cup Mr. Coffee, and it weighs so much less than the larger models when full, that it's easier for children and the elderly to handle. The lid comes off easily for refilling/cleaning, yet stays on securely when pouring. My 15-year old original BRITA pitcher bit the dust when I dropped it; was always happy with the filter itself, and how the water tastes. I appreciate this smaller version which takes up much less space in my side-by-side fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst filters ever
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever bought a printer for 50 bucks and then spent a ton of money on ink cartridges and felt dupped - then avoid getting this scam by Brita. These new models are intentionally designed so they get clogged up and you have no choice but to replace the filter. I haven't filtered much water at all before this started to happen. I googled this problem and quickly confirmed it wasn't a rarity. Avoid Brita's aggressive tactic to maximize their profits at the consumers expense. I'll never buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected (not for big families)
customer_reviews.text: The Brita filter was smaller than expected, but that's really my fault for not being able to conceptualize how much "5 cups" really is. However, it's perfect for someone living in a small studio, or for someone with a smaller sized fridge. I would not recommend this for big families, as you'll just end up refilling it non-stop. There's no grip on the handle, but 5 cups doesn't get too heavy, so it's fine. Filter is easy to swap in and out (comes with one for free). The red color is vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny W. Chan

customer_reviews.title: I wish sometimes they would just add any more coupons
customer_reviews.text: Add bodies all day good for you your pets plants and coffee I wish I could buy a bigger one I want to buy a huge one that way all-in-one all for all cheaper than stores cheaper than easy to handle and fun to keep filling up it takes a while but I was impress worth it every dime every nickel you never know keep in mind you never know when you're going to have a water main break or pipe problem this is the years where you need to prepare small one in the refrigerator the second part of the refrigerator third part refrigerator you never know and safe refill it outside
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Carknard

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this filter for about a month, and have had no problems so far. I was previously using a filter attached to my kitchen sink, which was a hand-me-down from a friend. It was bulky and got in the way. It didn't help that I hadn't kept up with filter changes or cleaning, so the water tasted funny on the rare occasions I switched it on. I like this pitcher style of filter a lot more, and find myself actually using it now. I feel more hydrated when I drink some water, instead of only coffee throughout the day. This product has helped to make a hydration lifestyle more appealing to me.
customer_reviews.author: AR1

customer_reviews.title: Nice and slim and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another Brita pitcher. My previous pitcher, which immediately went into the garbage, appeared to be two molded pieces and had a seam at the bottom which was not completely sealed. This seam was the perfect home for mold and I had no way to clean it. This pitcher appears to be one molded piece which makes cleaning it much easier and provides no place for mold to hide. The lid stays in place and the reservoir doesn’t move when water is being poured out, which the my previous pitcher annoyingly did. I’ve been happy with this pitcher and I’m no longer concerned about any spillage when I pour water.
customer_reviews.author: WookinPnub

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pitcher, fills fast!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve owned Brita pitchers for many years and for the most part they’ve worked out well except they’re a pain to clean because the top half doesn’t come apart easily. This pitcher is a size I’ve never bought before and I really appreciate it both because it fills up fast and because I can fill it up twice and still manage to lift it (the bigger ones hurt my wrist—I have tendinitis—if they are too full). I’ve had this one for about three weeks and so far it seems like a sturdy little thing. No unpleasant flavor to the water and easy to fill and pour.
customer_reviews.author: canted_angle

customer_reviews.title: Pitcher cracked top to bottom
customer_reviews.text: Literally just opened my package and the pitcher is cracked top to bottom. The package was handed right to me the Amazon box wasn't damaged at all. And, it's more than one crack. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great for Chicago water!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Chicago, where our water comes from the heavily polluted lake. The taste of the water is so bad, I never drink it out of the tap. In an effort to cut down on my use of plastic, I thought I’d give this pitcher a shot. I love it! The water taste is not quite as clean as some higher end bottled waters, but it’s a huge improvement over what I had, and every bit as good as store brand bottled water. And, the slim pitcher is perfect for one person, without taking up a lot of room in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: bandbgirl

customer_reviews.title: Top doesn't fit; insert doesn't come out
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many Britta pitchers over the years including one like this in another color. I had to replace that one because the insert wasn't coming out and it was impossible to fully clean. This NEW one is defective too. Not only does the insert not come out but the top does not fit on correctly. It seems like the top was not designed to fit with the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Nola Caine

customer_reviews.title: This was my 3rd Brita pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I think the filters really did help my water to taste fresher, on par with my previous Brita pitchers. However, I never could quite get the lid to fit properly. Finally I tried to force it and the pitcher broke. Never had a problem like this with previous pitchers. Also, the lights to display how much filter time is left were sketchy. It only displayed a number if I pressed a button, and it stayed at 100% wayyyyy too long. I don't think it was working properly. I did read and follow the directions. I've ordered a different Brita pitcher as a replacement - I hope it doesn't have the same issues!
customer_reviews.author: DLR

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if allergic to coconut
customer_reviews.text: Avoid if allergic to coconut as filters are made from coconut shells. Their website claims that this would be no issue but they are obviously lying. Also, the filter hardly removes the smell of the tap water that we have in CA - you'd have to run it through the filter many times (which obviously adds even more coconut allergens).
customer_reviews.author: George Matthews

customer_reviews.title: My lid is broken
customer_reviews.text: I think the filtered water tastes better because the filter element is good. But there is something wrong with the button on the lid. I suspect that what I received was a bad one. The button doesn't work. When you press the button, the little light next to it flashes and goes off. It does nothing to filter the water. Although the button on the lid is broken, it does not affect the drinking water. It is not convenient to return or change in special period, use reluctantly. But I can't give it full marks
customer_reviews.author: lily zhang

customer_reviews.title: Small but good!
customer_reviews.text: Was never interested in one of these until I realized how many plastic water bottles I was going through, tried my own tap water and it just didn’t taste right. This fixed it up! And I guess gets some of the bad stuff out? Not sure, really just got it for taste and to not use a gazillion water bottles. Only downside is how much I have to fill it, so if you drink a lot of water during the day I would suggest a larger one if there is one available.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for an urban 24" refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: I love this Brita pitcher. I live in a city condo with a compact 24" wide Bosch refrigerator. I previously had bought a Brita Stream pitcher because of its small size but Stream lacks the filtering qualities of the regular Brita pitchers. I hesitated to buy the Metro pitcher because the ad had 2 totally different sets of measurements. Glad I took a chance. Hurrah! The smaller dimensions were correct, allowing me to fit everthing in my refrigerator door. Could not be happier with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Y

customer_reviews.title: Works well but avoid drinking the last glass
customer_reviews.text: I carefully read all instructions included with the product and rinsed the filter for the 15 seconds it says and then some. I dumped the first two pitchers that we filled as well. I still after a couple months have noticed that nearly every time that we fill the pitcher there is always black stuff settled at the bottom. Now I assume that is normal and we don't drink that final glass out of it but it works well for filtering and keeping cold water in the refrigerator for us.
customer_reviews.author: Smcneil

customer_reviews.title: Been a fan of Brita for over 15 years
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with two other people so its the 3 of us to one fridge so that means I don't have much space to spare. I've been a Brita fan since I got my first one about 15 years ago. I was worried this wasn't going to hold enough water to even make a dent without being annoying to fill up all the time. However I been proved wrong This fills my whole water bottle with some to spare. I do fill it up every time I fill my water bottle just so I never run out of water. It is the perfect size if you don't have a lot of fridge space.
customer_reviews.author: Tizzawn

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for 1-2 people.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product with one exception. It's a durable sufficiently large containing for 1-2 people. The taste of the water is great. I live in an area where you really don't want to drink the water. I don't like removing the lid each time and replacing it each and every day. I have seen one container where the lid flips up and thus does not need to be removed. That is the best I've seen. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Fargo

customer_reviews.title: I would have liked to use it
customer_reviews.text: Its impossible to get the reservoir out of the pitcher for cleaning just like other people have complained about. When I took it out of the wrapping there was a broken off piece of plastic in the bottom that might have been some sort of release tab. If that was the case then that would have lasted 20 seconds before it broke off. If you cant take it apart to clean it then there is no point in keeping it and Ill just keep my old one for now since it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: While this 5 cup model takes up less space inside a refrigerator, it does not have a “flip-top lid (as in the larger 10 cup version) that makes refilling a breeze...” To add water you need to use two hands to open the top lid to refill. Putting the cover back is also a two hand process, with precision, otherwise it will not fit properly. In order for the digital filter-change Tomer/indicator to work properly you have to place it “on a flat surface” during refilling. This model has less capacity than the ten cup model so you need to repeat these steps several time a day. Not worth the trouble.... but the ten cup instead
customer_reviews.author: Wonderli

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: It’s the size I expected, I definitely want to note that, but I also want to express that when ordering, I should have gotten a bigger size. This is my first Brita and it’s been working great and I love it, but I refill it more often than I thought I would, and so if anyone is getting their first as well, think about how much you drink in a day and maybe consider a bigger size as this may not be the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Snesrud

customer_reviews.title: Black flakes from filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter is pretty terrible. Since the first use my husband and I noticed black flakes at the bottom of the glass after pouring water from it. We refilled the pitcher a few times to see if it would clear up the filter and we would still get flakes. Not sure what they are but we know for sure it’s coming from the filter. The water from the tap looks more clear than the water from the pitcher. I’d invest more money on a better quality filter pitcher.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't purchase this because of other reviews stating the filter wasn't working or that the jug was difficult to open/clean. I decided to write a review to let potential buyers know that it does work well and it easy to open! You have to make sure to twist the filter in and make sure the filter lines up with the opening to filter the water properly! Make sure to follow instructions and dump out the outlined amount of water before drinking!! Overall a great buy! I would say that this is more for single person use maybe two if you fill up the jug diligently.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Multiple cracks and the filter wont line up making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Doogie

customer_reviews.title: Long Filtering time required
customer_reviews.text: Was using this with my coffee pot because our water is extremely hard. I periodically have to remove the shower head, faucet aerators, etc. and clean them with vinegar to remove the buildup. I have to also clean the coffee machine often as well. So I figured if I could stop the cause first, it should work better. The pitcher filters slowly. You have to fill the top basin, place the cap back on and just leave it to slowly seep through the filter. It pours good, but is a pain for trying to filter as much coffee water as I require. I may opt instead for a coffee machine with a built in filter.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: optimum size and shape
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other Brita pitchers, this one is more practical by far. Half a pitcher will be sufficient for brewing a 20 oz coffee. The lid has no flimsy hinge like the previous pitcher I used, it just fits securely on the top and is removed with ease. The design is narrow, occupying little counter top or refrigerator space. It is easy to hold under the kitchen faucet for refill, which the larger models don't facilitate. The improvement in practicality is a result of a simple design.
customer_reviews.author: S. McQuinn

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy, happy
customer_reviews.text: I've had this now for a while, and every time I use it, I'm happy, happy. It is so pretty - color looks like my Caribbean blue Nissan CUBE car, and I love it. Fits perfectly in my 1.7 cu. ft. square fridge - I live on the beach in a remodeled student dormitory complex with lots of old folks, and it is PERFECT for my daily water consumption. Thank you Amazon, happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Adelheid Leuthardt

customer_reviews.title: Great Size, Confusing Filter Button
customer_reviews.text: Great size for my small fridge as someone who lives alone (perfect amount for 2-3 large glasses of filtered water. Great flavor. I trust that this filters my water adequately. Tbh I am a little confused how to use the filter button to "let the Brita know" I am filling it vs. resetting the filter thing (happens if you hold down "too long"). It is supposed to notify you to replace the filter after 200 refills, but I'll just take a guess and replace it when it feels right.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: It’s small. I have to refill it 6-7 times a day or more. Not Britas fault per say. Bigger problem is the green algae that formed on the bottom, which apparently is common if you don’t refrigerate the tank. It’s also not dishwasher safe, and cheap plastic material. Quality of the water is the only thing this has going for it. I’d advise Brita to focus more on creating better units rather than cheap ones that are designed to be exactly that so they can keep selling you the filters which is the real money maker. I’d also advise anyone in the Brita or water filtration market to do more research before buying
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: there are few things i've purchased on a whim at a bargain from amazon that i still use. this item is one of them. it does exactly what it says it does. easy to clean, change filters, and refill. i do not recommend using this to filter anything except water, you probably could, but you'll also probably have to switch out filters.
customer_reviews.author: tribey

customer_reviews.title: Stay hydrated!
customer_reviews.text: I was continuously buying water bottles for college and I was going through them so fast. Water bottles are generally inexpensive, but, I go through it quickly, especially in this California heat. I decided to invest in this, as I wanted to drink from the faucet. I wanted something for home that I could use, since I thought that going through my finite supply of water bottles to drink at home, instead of outside, would be counter intuitive. All in all, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye nasty city water!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who hates their city water and would rather dehydrate themselves, this has been a blessing. My water has a taste that I can’t stand and this completely cures that issue. My water is tasteless and even tastes fine with my leaving it out. It comes with the filter, which is so nice too! I like the design and that it’s super simple to put together. I recommend this product, especially if you don’t want to pay a lot like me.
customer_reviews.author: Selene Stars

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with chip in pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I am so grateful that there is an easy way to return this pitcher. I opened it, soaked the filter, threw away all packaging, and then it began to leak over everything! We then noticed a hole- like a chip in the plastic. I will return it today. Thank you, Amazon, for making this easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Smaller picture is a winner
customer_reviews.text: I wanted access to clean purified water out of the refrigerator. That was the goal. The smaller Brita unit is much better for us. The picture is easier to handle, don't really need 2 gallons of water all the time. And the unit filters the water pretty quickly... And by the way we get the filters from Amazon direct so we get them at a very good discount so we are swapping filters out sooner and the water tastes better longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E. May

customer_reviews.title: Split within a month of use
customer_reviews.text: The carafe split during the first month of use. I purchased as a second purifier to my Pur, but will not be replacing. In fact, switched to Aquagear which is a bit more expensive than Brita and Pur, but removes fluoride--the only pitcher purifier that I found removes fluoride and all the other crap in water (lead, mercury, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Cjg

customer_reviews.title: Grabbed this for the office
customer_reviews.text: I was raised by a mother that did not trust water fountains. I also have recently got on board with using less plastic bottles so I purchased this small pitcher for work. I definitely see a difference in the water quality using this. I imagine it tastes better but I refuse the drink the water from work without it so I can’t vouch much for the change in taste. I fill it up first thing in the morning and on most days it lasts my 8 hour shift.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It is a Brita, and I will give them credit for that. HOWEVER! It is almost impossible to remove the filter holder! Really have to struggle with that. And the spout is open to the elements. What good is that? Would not purchase again. What a disappointment; I have been a Brita user for years. This is almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect 82

customer_reviews.title: Fast water purificaqtion
customer_reviews.text: The Breta picture water purifier works great. It is fast, and provides better water for my misting humidifiers at home. It does not remove all solids nor is it as efficient as our RO system, but it also does not waste water like the RO. The humidifiers still need cleaning but I feel better about not putting bacteria etc. into the misting water that may affect my health. For the cost and reassurance of better improved water, it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J. Estvander

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useful little jug, but doesn't have huge capacity, good for smaller apartments
customer_reviews.text: I've used Brita pitchers before and found them to be just fine, and this new Metro pitcher works as advertised, however, keep in mind that it's not ideal for larger families or larger homes with lots of roommates, as its reservoir is of modest size. Regarding the setup, it's relatively quick: just wet the filter, pour through three pitchers of water, turn on the filter replacement reminder thing, then you're ready to go! It's hard to say a ton about this product since it works relatively well and has few drawbacks, but if you go with this pitcher, you probably won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Newland

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love the flavor in function, my only complaint is that the indicator light took forever to change to red so I change the filter but it's still showing red. So all in all I just can't use the indicator, but still a great product. I have real strong well water and even after a Culligan whole house filter it was still pretty bad until I ran it through the Brita. After the filter it could have passed for a bottled water.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Item
customer_reviews.text: I have a Brita pitcher I've been using since January. Still works great. I needed another pitcher for my son to take to college so ordered this one - just like mine. When I unwrapped it, I noticed it felt lighter and the plastic was flimsy. Put the filter in and tried to pour water in from the faucet but it barely went through the filter. Completely useless. Returned this and ordered one from Target. Amazon needs to be sure they are getting original items - not knock-offs.
customer_reviews.author: LLange

customer_reviews.title: Second defective Brita
customer_reviews.text: The first pitcher I bought at Walmart and it had a defective part so I didn't even put it together. The second one purchased on Amazon would not seat the filter. About 25 percent of the water gets filtered, but the rest goes around the filter. The third time will not be the charm as I am done with Brita.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G

customer_reviews.title: Fake product
customer_reviews.text: I want to give 0 star. I bought 3 pieces and 1st broke within 1 week and second one filtering part chipped and is started to fall apart. Same as someone’s video, water comes out as fast as you pour it in . I doubt it really filters any because it doesn’t even take 10 seconds to come out what you pour in. I had many Brita pitchers I bought from Costco and are worth for it’s money. This is some fake product.
customer_reviews.author: fremil

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heathen that just drinks tap water, usually. After living in southern Louisiana (and probably getting some kind of horrible amoeba from the tap water there), I was disappointed when I moved to California and the tap water tasted of heavy metal and also altered my sense of taste. On my boyfriend's advice, because I drink a lot of water and can't afford to stay stocked up on bottled, I bought this. It's nice to have my sense of taste back!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean, leaves a weird taste
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago to filter my water. The first thing I'll say is the plastic material doesn't come apart easily which makes it really difficult to clean this pitcher. The price was great, but I expected better from it. The actual taste of the water is not so great. The only good thing is that the pitcher fits easily on my fridge shelf. I don't think I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: carloseats

customer_reviews.title: Smaller model but better for counter space
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking it was bigger but now that I got it, I am actually fine with it being smaller than our last one, as it takes up less counter space. Our last one had a lid that you pour through, as in the center fell down when you pour water in it, allowing you to not have to pop the lid off but this one makes you take the lid off completely. All in all, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cat, I don't feel safe letting him drink tap water because I'm afraid it could ruin his health. I found out that the minerals in bottled water are bad for pets as well, so I decided it would be the best to buy a quality filter pitch. I know this is a good brand that I can trust, so I'm glad I bought this. The filter indicator light is a great design.
customer_reviews.author: J.U.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. No more water bottles and no more that chemical smell from the tap. I first used Brita at my friend’s and decided to buy one for my self. I figured the 10-cup size is heavy to lift with full water so my 5-cup is just perfect ^^. I actually prefer the kind-of-bluegreen color but bought the red one because it’s cheaper... That’s the thing I dont like about the seller. Anyway, you shouldn’t buy the white one because it looks very old over time.
customer_reviews.author: iris b.

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. A bit overpriced in my book.
customer_reviews.text: It's small so you will need to put water in it several times during the day. It's a pain to take the lid off and on and takes both hands to hold the pitcher while you pry the lid completely off with your other hand. I wish I would have bought the larger pitcher where you could just flip open the lid with your thumb and load with water.
customer_reviews.author: shaunb

customer_reviews.title: Check your water
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for three days. Followed the instructions as directed and even went above and beyond and rinsed the filter longer then the minimum time. Three days later (I’ve filled this Brita 4 times already) I notice these blue specs in my water. Me and my family have been drinking this. Not happy at all and if I remember correctly these were the same specs that were supposed to be rinsed out during the install I did a couple days ago (on the instructions). Threw out the packaging already so now I’m left with a product I won’t use.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but filter goes out quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is cute and a good size for one person, but the filter isn't the greatest. I got it in April and already it seems to not be filtering my water--it just goes straight through. So now it's more of a placebo filter. When I click the "check filter" button, it says the filter is still at 100% functionality but it's a lie.
customer_reviews.author: Burlap

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Had pitcher for about 9 months and have loved it. It is light weight and was much easier to hold than my larger model. However, you should be aware that after 9 months of use it split down the seam. I went to pour water one day and water went everywhere. Upon examination, I found it had split over half way down the front along the seam. Very dissatisfied. I have owned other models in the past that have last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Consultant

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly in my refrigerator
customer_reviews.text: I recently thought I'd try a Brita as so many of my friends rave about how much better the water tastes from it. I've been trying to drink more water and so I thought I'd give it a try. I'm not sorry I did. It makes my drinking water, coffee and tea and other things I use water in taste so much better. I could really tell the difference when I forgot to use it one day and filled up a glass out of the tall. The tap water tasted dirty in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Blue DragonflyTop Contributor: Cooking

product_meta.title: Brita Water Pitcher with 1 Filter, BPA Free, 5 Cup, White
product_meta.description: Color:White| Style:Standard Filter| Pattern Name:Water PitcherDrink healthier, great tasting tap water with this BPA free Brita 5 cup water pitcher. With the Advanced filter technology, Brita cuts the taste and odor of chlorine to deliver great tasting water, and is certified to reduce copper, cadmium and mercury impurities, which can adversely affect your health over time. This Brita water pitcher is ergonomically design with a flip top lid that makes refilling a breeze and an electronic filter indicator that lets you know when it is time to change the Brita replacement filter. The small pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.
feature_bullets: SMALL WATER PITCHER: This small, plastic water filtration pitcher is easy to pour and refill. The space efficient pitcher fits perfectly on refrigerator shelves and is great for families. Height 9.8; Width 4.45; Length/Depth 9.37; Weight 1.39 pounds

CLEANER AND GREAT TASTING: The BPA free Brita filter reduces chlorine (taste and odor), copper, mercury, zinc and cadmium impurities found in tap water for cleaner great tasting water. Substances reduced may not be in all users' water
FILTER CHANGE REMINDER: For optimum performance, a helpful status indicator on your filtered water pitcher notifies you when your water filter needs to be replaced
REPLACEMENTS: Change Brita standard filters every 40 gallons, about 2 months for the average household for optimal performance – that’s 2.5x longer than Zerowater filters
